enWisdom: Haste prevents one from [successfully] achieving his goal
The hasty one is in the wrong, even if he acquires [what he seeks]
The hasty one errs or is close to [erring]

Wisdom: ذَرِ الْعَجَلَ فَإِنَّ الْعَجِلَ فِي الْأُمُورِ لَا يُدْرِكُ مَطْلَبَهُ وَلَا يُحْمَدُ أَمْرُهُ
enWisdom: Leave haste aside, for indeed the one who is hasty in matters neither attains what he seeks nor is his affair praised
It is seldom that the view of a hasty person turns out to be correct

Wisdom: قَلَّمَا تَنْجَحُ حِيلَةُ الْعَجُولِ أَوْ تَدُومُ مَوَدَّةُ الْمَلُولِ
enWisdom: It is seldom that the scheme of the hasty is successful or that the love of the one who is fed up lasts
There is no achievement for the hasty
